moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. Nf3 e6 3. c4 d5 4. Nc3 Bb4: I think it's better to keep the tension by playing Bh4 especially when you cant take d5 yet...
moves.7... Qxf6 8. cxd5 exd5: Black gains open space and the C8 Bishop is alive again...
moves.9. Be2 Bf5 10. O-O Bxc3: now! so there will be no threat on d5. meanwhile, black managed his peaces in the king side...
moves.11. bxc3 Nd7 12. Rc1: wants to play c4 and gain the center back. But, when there is no Knight on c3 an no Bishop on d3 who will move the white Bishop from e4?
moves.12... Be4 13. c4: I think it was better to play Nd2 to keep the Bishop away and to preper c4.
moves.13... dxc4 14. Rxc4 c6 15. Nd2: too late, now there is a place to be on the long diagonal.
moves.15... Bd5 16. Rc2 Qg6: to prevent e4 and to threat mate.
